products.name: Avocado
products.details: The base of any cetogen diet.

products.name: Eggs (12p)
products.details: One egg has only 75 calories but 7 grams of high-quality protein, 5 grams of fat, and 1.6 grams of saturated fat, along with iron, vitamins, minerals, and carotenoids. The egg is a powerhouse of disease-fighting nutrients like lutein and zeaxanthin.

products.name: Green beans
products.details: The good: This food is low in Sodium, and very low in Saturated Fat and Cholesterol. It is also a good source of Protein, Thiamin, Riboflavin, Niacin, Vitamin B6, Calcium, Iron, Magnesium, Phosphorus, Potassium and Copper, and a very good source of Dietary Fiber, Vitamin A, Vitamin C, Vitamin K, Folate and Manganese.

products.name: Steak tartare
products.details: Steak tartare is a meat dish made from raw ground meat. It is often served with onions, capers and seasonings, sometimes with a raw egg yolk, and often on rye bread. The name tartare is sometimes generalized to other raw meat or fish dishes

products.name: Salmon (raw)
products.details: Nutritional Breakdown. For every 3 ounces of salmon you eat, you take in around 121 calories and 17 grams of protein. Salmon is known as a fatty fish; it contains 5.4 grams of fat per 3 ounces, but less than 1 gram of that is saturated fat.

products.name: Coconut cream
products.details: Coconut cream is very similar to coconut milk but contains less water. The difference is mainly consistency. It has a thicker, more paste-like consistency, while coconut milk is generally a liquid.
